intro: Schoenoplectus confusus, commonly known as the confused bulrush, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense stands that help stabilize shoreline ecosystems. Its flowering spikes are usually pale green to brown, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Schoenoplectus confusus plays an important role in wetland biodiversity and water filtration.
